required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Intracranial Pressure in Experimental Models of Headache
clinical_study.official_title: Intracranial Pressure in Experimental Models of Headache

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether increased pressure in the head is elevated in people who suffer from High Altitude Headache. We hypothesise that head pressure will be elevated in people with High Altitude Headache.

detailed_description.textblock: High Altitude Headache is the primary symptom of Acute Mountain Sickness. However, at present the reason why some individuals suffer from High Altitude Headache and others do not remains unknown. It is widely believed that elevated pressure within the brain leads to stretching of pain sensitive fibres and thus headache. However, evidence of raised intracranial pressure during High Altitude Headache is currently unavailable. Therefore, this study aims to examine a proxy measure of intracranial pressure (Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter) in persons visiting High Altitude, half of whom have been given the drug acetazolamide that is known to reduce headache symptoms.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter by Ultrasonography
primary_outcome.time_frame: Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter: baseline, 24 hours.
primary_outcome.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurement. 24 hours is defined at the 24 hour hypoxia measurement. Optic nerve sheath diameter obtained by ultrasonography of the eye. Increased optic nerve sheath diameter suggests greater intra cranial pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in High Altitude Headache by Visual Analogue Scale
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurement. 24 hours is defined at the 24 hour hypoxia measurement. Outcome measured using visual analogue scale, where 0 mm is no headache and 100 mm is maximum headache.
Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurement. 24 hours is defined at the 24 hour hypoxia measurement.

Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurement. 24 hours is defined at the 24 hour hypoxia measurement. Urine output was recorded by 24 hour urine collection and fluid intake by 24 hour food diaries. Fluid balance was calculated as: (urine output (L) / fluid intake (L) ) * 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter: baseline, 3 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour 12 hour normoxia measurements. 3 hours is defined at the 3 hour hypoxia measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter: baseline, 12 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour 12 hour normoxia measurements. 12 hours is defined at the 12 hour hypoxia measurement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter: baseline, 36 hours.
secondary_outcome.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurements. 36 hours is defined at the 36 hour hypoxia measurement.

arm_group.description: Arm 1: ACETAZOLAMIDE (250mg) will be given to subjects at fifteen, twenty and thirty two hours post hypoxic exposure (3777m).
Placebo (LACTOSE MONOHYDRATE) will be given to subjects at fifteen, twenty and thirty two hours post hypoxic exposure (3777m).

intervention.description: During a forty eight hour hypoxic exposure (3777m), subjects will be given either acetazolamide or placebo at hours fifteen, twenty and thirty two.
During a forty eight hour hypoxic exposure (3777m), subjects will be given either acetazolamide or placebo at hours fifteen, twenty and thirty two.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Member of the Italian High Altitude Research Expeditions
Exclusion Criteria:
- Are under the age of 18years;
- sulfonamide allergy
- Liver or kidney disfunction
- Have any other uncontrolled medical condition
- Or are unable to give consent.

facility.name: School of Sport, Health and Exercise Sciences, Bangor University

clinical_study.keyword: High Altitude Headache; intra-cranial pressure; hypoxia

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Participants attending the Antur Ymchwil 2011 Expedition to the European Alps were recruited between 01.07.11 and 01.08.11.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Participants completed two trials, including a 12 hour sea level exposure followed by a 36 hour high altitude exposure (3777m). Participants were assigned to one of two groups based on High-altitude headache susceptibility determined by visual analogue score obtained after 12 hours at high altitude. No participants were excluded.

group.description: Arm 1: ACETAZOLAMIDE (250mg) will be given to subjects at fifteen, twenty and thirty two hours post hypoxic exposure (3777m).

outcome.title: Change in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter by Ultrasonography
outcome.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurement. 24 hours is defined at the 24 hour hypoxia measurement. Optic nerve sheath diameter obtained by ultrasonography of the eye. Increased optic nerve sheath diameter suggests greater intra cranial pressure.
outcome.time_frame: Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter: baseline, 24 hours.
outcome.population: All participants were included. Analysis was intention to treat. There were no missing data.

group.title: Acetazolamide
group.description: Arm 1: ACETAZOLAMIDE (250mg) will be given to subjects at fifteen, twenty and thirty two hours post hypoxic exposure (3777m).

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo (LACTOSE MONOHYDRATE) will be given to subjects at fifteen, twenty and thirty two hours post hypoxic exposure (3777m).

measure.title: Change in Optic Nerve Sheath Diameter by Ultrasonography
measure.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurement. 24 hours is defined at the 24 hour hypoxia measurement. Optic nerve sheath diameter obtained by ultrasonography of the eye. Increased optic nerve sheath diameter suggests greater intra cranial pressure.
measure.population: All participants were included. Analysis was intention to treat. There were no missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: Omnibus analysis was performed. 2 (drug: Acetazolamide versus placebo) * 2 (susceptibility: high altitude headache resistant versus high altitude headache susceptible) * 6 (time: sea level, 3 & 12; high altitude, 3, 12, 24 & 36 hours) analysis of variance with repeated measures on the third factor. Data presented here are for the drug * time interaction.
analysis.method_desc: Adjustments to the degrees of freedom were made when assumptions of sphericity were violated.

outcome.description: Baseline is defined as the average of the 3 hour and 12 hour normoxia measurement. 24 hours is defined at the 24 hour hypoxia measurement. Outcome measured using visual analogue scale, where 0 mm is no headache and 100 mm is maximum headache.
outcome.population: All participants were included. Analysis was intention to treat. There were no missing data.

analysis.groups_desc: Post hoc follow up test. T test between acetazolamide and placebo on data at 24 hr time point.
analysis.p_value_desc: Step down Holm Bonferroni correction was applied

reported_events.time_frame: Study data collection period only (baseline and high altitude exposures up to 36 hours).
reported_events.desc: Adverse events recorded by study investigators at six hourly interviews.

group.title: Acetazolamide
group.description: Arm 1: ACETAZOLAMIDE (250mg) will be given to subjects at fifteen, twenty and thirty two hours post hypoxic exposure (3777m).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: All Principal Investigators ARE employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Acetazolamide did not reduce high altitude headache as expected. Nevertheless the relationship between optic nerve sheath diameter and headache could still be determined by completing other analyses.
